com.sri.kernel.modules
Interface Module

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultModule
public interface Module

A base type of module. All modules must be a child of this class.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots
See Also:
DefaultModule

Method Detail

initModule

public boolean initModule(ModuleData md)
Called when the module is loaded. If this returns false, the module will not load.

Parameters:
md - The given ModuleData.
Returns:
True if the module has successfully initialized, false otherwise.

cleanupModule

public void cleanupModule()
Called when the module is unloaded.

runDiagnostic

public boolean runDiagnostic(int level,
                             java.io.PrintStream ps)
Called to diagnose the module at the given level. All output or messages should be printed to the given PrintStream.

Parameters:
level - The level of the diagnostic.
ps - The print stream to which messages should be written.
Returns:
true if the diagnostic passed, false if there was error.
See Also:
Diagnostics

getSRMLElements

public java.util.Vector getSRMLElements()
Called after the module has been successfully loaded. Performs the registration of provided SRML Elements.

Returns:
The SRML Elements provided.

getDependencies

public java.util.Vector getDependencies()
After the module has been instantiated, and before it is initialized the dependencies are checked, and loaded if needed. If a dependency doesn't exist or fails to load the current module will not load. The object types within the list must be String[]. The String[] array must have a length of two. String[0] is the name of the module, and String[1] is the version.

Returns:
The dependencies.

getNeededBy

public java.util.Vector getNeededBy()
This method is called when the module is loaded. It is used to ensure that no modules need this module, meaning it is safe to remove and will not break any dependencies. Unlike the dependencies, this uses an object type of String which represents the name of the module.

Returns:
The modules which need this module.

addNeededBy

public void addNeededBy(java.lang.String moduleName)
This is called when a module is loaded that depends on this module. When a dependency is found, the dependency will be loaded, and the addNeededBy method of the dependency will be called with the name of the dependent module. If for instance, module A needs module B, then when module A is loaded B.addNeededBy("A") will be called after B has been loaded.

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module which needs this module.

configurationChange

public void configurationChange()
Will be called when a configuration option has been changed at runtime. This method is not used at this time
